title: YData: An Introduction to Data Science
xlist:
Same As: S&DS 523, section 01
Same As: CPSC 123, section 01
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Quantitative Reasoning Yale College distributional requirement.
ci_attrs: YC Global Affairs: Research Design
description: Computational, programming, and statistical skills are no longer optional in our increasingly data-driven world; these skills are essential for opening doors to manifold research and career opportunities. This course aims to dramatically enhance knowledge and capabilities in fundamental ideas and skills in data science, especially computational and programming skills along with inferential thinking. YData is an introduction to Data Science that emphasizes the development of these skills while providing opportunities for hands-on experience and practice.Â YData is accessible to students with little or no background in computing, programming, or statistics, but is also engaging for more technically oriented students through extensive use of examples and hands-on data analysis. Python 3, a popular and widely used computing language, is the language used in this course. The computing materials will be hosted on a special purpose web server.
